history.text: Hello!
Hey, are you there?
I am!
Okay, so the movie I need to convince you to watch is Toy Story.
So what movie are we talking about?
The original 1995 Toy Story
All right, haven't seen that one.
I think I've only seen some sequel or something.
Can you tell me some actors that did the voice over for the characters in the movie?
I definitely think you should watch the original because it establishes the plot for the subsequent movies
Yeah, I guess you're right.
Tom Hanks is plays Woody, the protagonist. Tim Allen is Buzz Lightyear, the second protagonist
Oh, I totally love Tom Hanks and I think I've heard of Tim Allen as well.
So, what's the movie about
The movie is a kids' movie, but it was the first feature-length movie made entirely by computer animation. It's basically about these toys that come to life
I understand...I now remember some parts of other Toy Story movies. The animations were awesome.
Can you please tell me a bit more related to the plot? What are Woody and Buzz trying to do?
Their owners (Andy and his family) are moving to a hew ouse and they somehow get left behind during the move, so Buzz and Woody (plus a few other toys) make this crazy journey to Andy's new house.
Hmm, that seems really interesting
What else?
Buzz and Woody were initially not big fans of each other, but as the movie goes on, they grow to become best friends.
Some of the most important plot points:
Yeah, from what I know they were best friends
When Buzz originally meets Woody and his group of friends, Woody's friends were quite impressed by Buzz's high-tech gadgets. Woody was not a fan.
I see...seems like a great start though!
What else happened throughout the movie? And if you can, please also give me some teasers about the ending.

The two eventually find themselves in a situation where they could easily be killed/ruined by Andy's destructive teenage neighbor, who is known for violently smashing and blowing up toys. This forces them to become allies in order to save themselves.
Hmm, nice development!
After several hiccups, Buzz, Woody, and the other toys left behind eventually complete their journey to Andy's new house
Also, I would like to find out more about the critical response of the movie? Was it good/bad/mixed? What did critics say?
Because I usually prefer to check out the rating of a movie before watching it. Of course, I prefer those with good rating (7/10 +)
The critics all gave consistently high scores. Rotten Tomatoes gave it 100%
Metacritic gave it a 95/100, and CinemaScore gave it an A.
All the detailed reviews were full of praise regarding plot development, attention to detail, and the general concept of the film as a whole.
Wow! I'm amazed! Those are some scores huh
They really are! There are very few movies with an RT rating of 100%, so I'm glad this got the ranking it deserved.
Anyways, from what I hear, they are justified!
All right then, thank you for your chat and for informing me about this movie!
Have a good weekend, goodbye!
You're welcome! It was nice chatting with you and I hope you check Toy Story Out!
Bye!

uid1response.feedback: Pretty smooth flow, though I would have liked to see a message in the chat stating "User1 is typing.../User2 is typing..." to know the other person is actively responding.

uid2response.feedback: I will watch the movie because the person I chatted with really made it sound like an awesome movie to watch. He highlighted the important parts of the plot, told me about the actors and finally, we spoke about the critical response.
